Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the prophecy made by David Wilkerson in 1986.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the COVID-19 pandemic is the fulfillment of the prophecy, without providing concrete evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the shutdown of bars, churches, and government, as well as the impact on New York City, which are not addressed in the claim.
Contradict fact: The Times Square Church, established by David Wilkerson, denies that he ever made this prediction, contradicting the claim.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential impact of the prophecy by not providing enough context or details.
Falters at times: The claim falters in terms of providing consistent and reliable evidence to support the prophecy.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance and accuracy of the prophecy by linking it directly to the COVID-19 pandemic.
